definitions.definition: A barrier that has parallel or crossed bars blocking a passage but admitting air.
A frame of iron bars to hold a fire.
The loose material that comes from something being grated.
examples: Add a few gratings of nutmeg to the hot milk.

definitions.definition: An optical system of close equidistant and parallel lines or bars, especially lines ruled on a polished surface, used for producing spectra by diffraction .
The strong wooden lattice used to cover a hatch , admitting light and air; also, a movable lattice used for the flooring of boats.
The sound made by something that grates against something else.

main_definition: A barrier that has parallel or crossed bars blocking a passage but admitting air.
secondary_definitions: A frame of iron bars to hold a fire.
The loose material that comes from something being grated.
An optical system of close equidistant and parallel lines or bars, especially lines ruled on a polished surface, used for producing spectra by diffraction .
( nautical , in the plural ) The strong wooden lattice used to cover a hatch , admitting light and air; also, a movable lattice used for the flooring of boats.
The sound made by something that grates against something else.
